section.title: Overview
section.para: The JBoss JCA/Fungal kernel is a Plain Old Java Object (POJO) based kernel which can build a container environment for Java services.

The focus of the Fungal kernel is simplicity and high performance.

section.title: Parallel deployment and dependency resolution
section.para: JBoss JCA/Fungal uses multiple threads during the booting sequence.
When multiple threads are used in the kernel a dependency mechanism between beans is needed. The kernel keeps track of each bean deployment and assigns a status
Caveats: The kernel currently doesn't detect cyclic dependencies between deployment units.
Furthermore the dependencies between beans are recorded in order to be able to safely shutdown deployments.
Note, that all deployment units in the deploy directory are booted in sequence defined by the File.listFiles() method.

section.title: Classloading
section.para: JBoss JCA/Fungal features a simple 3-level classloader model:

listitem.para: Top-level classloader that loads the Fungal kernel. This class loader is controlled by the application that uses the kernel.
An URLClassLoader based class loader with AppCL as its parent which loads all libraries used by the kernel.
Each deployment is running in its own classloader with KernelCL as its parent.

section.title: Deployers
section.para: JBoss JCA/Fungal features a very simple deployers mechanism.
Each deployer is defined as a bean in a bean deployment XML file and they must implement the
interface.
The interface contains the
section.programlisting: /** * Deploy * @param url The URL for the deployment * @param parent The parent classloader * @return The deployment; or null if no deployment was made * @exception DeployException Thrown if an error occurs */ public Deployment deploy(URL url, ClassLoader parent) throws DeployException;
section.para: method which is invoked once with each of the files in the $JBOSS_JCA_HOME/deploy/ directory.
The Deployment interface returned represents the deployment unit or null if a deployment unit wasn't created.
The implementation of the deployer bean must be thread-safe. This can be done by using the synchronized keyword on the deploy method.

section.title: Remote protocol
section.para: JBoss JCA/Fungal features a remote protocol to allow deployment and undeployment of units.
The protocol is based on the java.io.ObjectInputStream and java.io.ObjectOutputStream format over a standard java.net.Socket connection.
The kernel must be configured with KernelConfiguration.remoteAccess(true) in order to enable remote access.
